H0.text: who controlled the house and the senate in 2012. Republican

H1.text: who controlled the house and the senate in 2012. Libertarian

H2.text: who controlled the house and the senate in 2012. Independent

H3.text: who controlled the house and the senate in 2012. Democratic

A4.text: The House was controlled by the Republican Party in 2012, while the Senate was controlled by the Democratic Party.

A5.text: The Democrats gained Republican-held seats in Massachusetts and Indiana and one from an Independent Democrat in Connecticut, leaving them with a total of 53 seats.

A6.text: Both Independents would caucus with the Democrats, forming a majority caucus with a combined total of 55 seats.

A7.text: Democrats picked up eight seats in the House of Representatives but failed to gain a majority, despite winning the popular vote.

A8.text: Democrats retained control of the Senate, picking up two net seats in the election.
